OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: The Reserved Matters pursuant to outline planning permission ref 3/06/0769/OUT, namely Appearance, Scale and Landscaping, along with a scheme to accommodate bats, in connection with the erection of 89 dwellings and associated works

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Erection of 10 dwellings with associated parking

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Demolition of existing open air car sales and motor repair workshop and erection of 27 sheltered apartments for the elderly

SiteNameAddress: Stapehill Church Site Wimborne Road West Stapehill Wimborne
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Change of Use From Place of Worship to Residential and Construct Block of Six Flats

OwnershipStatus: mixed ownership
Notes: Prior Approval for Change of Use from Offices (B1) to Residential Comprising of 24 x One Bedroom Apartments

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: demolition of existing buildings and redevelopment to provide 210 dwellings

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Developability of this site will depend on the viability of the existing uses. Theoretical density (90% of site at 60 DPH) = 45. Given edge of Green Belt location assume 35.

SiteNameAddress: Dorset Soldier PH, Wareham Road, Corfe Mullen
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Site submitted by landowner as part of Local Plan Review 2017. Assessed potential of up to 12 dwellings which is realistic for a flatted scheme.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Garage site has potential for re-development, subject to the viability of the business. However, conversion to flats of the adjacent property suggests some likelihood that it will happen.. Potential assessed for 20 flats

SiteNameAddress: Verwood Industrial Estate, Black Hill, Verwood
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: This site is occupied by the Blackhill Industrial Estate and the adjacent builder's supplies depot. It is unlikely that the industrial estate will come forward for redevelopment in the near future. There is a greater likelihood is the builders merchants. Approximately 25 dwellings.

SiteNameAddress: Northern Portion Flight Refuelling Site, Brook Road, Wimborne
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Landowner has also expressed an interest in releasing the land for housing or a foodstore. There is a current live application for additional parking so consider only 50% of the site available for housing currently so approximately 50 dwellings.. Approximately 50 dwellings.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: A well located site with excellent links to the town centre and transport links. However the landowner has expressed viability issues in the current economic climate.

SiteNameAddress: British Legion Club, West Borough, Wimborne
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Potential for complete redevelopment of site for flats or mews cottages

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Potential for a number of units on this site close to the town centre if the business were to relocate.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: The Furzehill Council Offices were considered surplus to requirements following the partnership working between Christchurch and East Dorset Councils.

SiteNameAddress: Post Office and Co-op, Smugglers Lane, Colehill
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: The Post Office and shop are unlikely to come forward in the near future as the building has recently been refurbished and just retained the post office. It may come forward towards the end of the period for flats.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: Net dwellings potential only for brownfield element of the CM1 allocation. This site forms new neighbourhood CM1 in the adopted Core Strategy. Lockyers School element of site is expected to come forward towards the end of the plan period

SiteNameAddress: The Post Office and 124 Ringwood Road, Longham
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: The site lies partially within the existing settlement boundary and partially within the green belt in an where an Exceptions Site may be acceptable

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Two dwellings removed from original SHLAA site. Area to west outside of builders merchants site could come forward on its own. 25.08.17 Updated capacity to 80 units as within 60dph density zone and within urban area.

SiteNameAddress: Stone Lane Industrial Estate, Stone Lane, Pamphill
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: This is site of the new neighbourhood WMC6 at Stone Lane in the adopted Core Strategy. Scheduled for end of Plan period.

SiteNameAddress: Red Lion, Church Street, Sturminster Marshall
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: The site is within the existing settlement boundary, but the southern half of the site is affected by flood risk. There is though potential to convert the existing building into flats.

SiteNameAddress: Tap and Railway Public House, 195 Station Road, West Moors
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: This pub site would be suitable for high density flats, possibly over shops, as it lies between a sheltered housing scheme and a parade of shops with flats over in the commercial centre of the village

SiteNameAddress: West Moors Library, Station Road, West Moors
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: The Library site could be redeveloped for library/community uses on the ground floor with flats above. However, this is unlikely to happen until towards the end of the Plan period.

SiteNameAddress: Car Park rear of 1-5, High Street
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Allocated as a car park in the current Local Plan, will retain an important town centre car park function with the re ordering of The Square, where parking will be lost. Part of the site is Flood zone 3.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Half the original SHLAA site is within the curtilage of the Grade II* LB which has been removed from this brownfield entry. Away from the listed building, there is potential on the yard to the east.

SiteNameAddress: Old Road Car Park and Old Dairy, Wimborne
OwnershipStatus: mixed ownership
Notes: Marks Yard element of SHLAA site removed and shown as a separate Brownfield entry. EDDC have determined to dispose of the car park for housing (approx 8 units). The builder's office (former dairy) is now available, the latter may be towards the end of the plan period.

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: Potential to replace the old school buildings with sympathetically designed dwellings that will enhance the townscape and surveillance of the park.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: New dwellings potential amended from original SHLAA site analysis to omit back gardens. Potential with the Builders Hire Depot in the centre of the site - rather than with the Victorian cottages or modern flats

OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: Potential conversion of Victorian building to provide 12 units if the Adult Education Centre no longer remains viable.
